creator: peter.junell@dg-konsult.se
text:
Hi,

I have installed APACHE on a new clean Windows98 machine with the latest 
updates from MS. When I start APACHE in the console everything gets slow and it 
takes minutes to minimize the console window. If I try to start another 
application that to takes minutes. If I presss ctrl-alt-delete I can se to 
apache processes on with capatilezed letters (APACHE) and on without (apache).

If I try to enter the address to the webserver on another computer in my 
network i can see that the browser is trying to connect to the webserver but 
the apache velcome page is not shown.

The error log shows following:

[Wed Mar 24 21:06:34 2004] [notice] Parent: Created child process -132739
[Wed Mar 24 21:06:35 2004] [notice] Child -132739: Child process is running
[Wed Mar 24 21:06:35 2004] [notice] Child -132739: Acquired the start mutex.

Shutting down the server.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
| Try using the Win32DisableAcceptEx directive

Have you tried it?

creator: 7iyt-vinf@spamex.com
text:
Just an observation that I hope will shed some light...

I was experiencing similar problems with the 2.0.49 build on a clean Win98 install.

I uninstalled 2.0.49 and then installed 2.0.47 (which I was running previously
without incident).  Apache then was able to run without errors.

No further response, assuming problem resolved. If this is not the case and you
supply the requested information, feel free to reopen the report.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
On Windows 98SE (version 4.10.2222 A)with Apache 2.0.49, the same problem was 
resolved with the directive "Win32DisableAcceptEx".  The installer script 
should add this directive to the configuration for Win98, but it doesn't...
creator: Apache@AtomicWizard.com
Apache@AtomicWizard.com
text:
I reopened the bug, because it is difficult for a new user to fix the 
configuration when the PC hangs on bootup, so you can't edit the file, when you 
don't know what to change.

I used the Windows installer (MSIEXEC version 2.00.2600.2) with the file 
apache_2.0.49-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi.  This added the following registry entry...
"Apache2"="\"C:\\PROGRAM FILES\\APACHE GROUP\\APACHE2\\BIN\\APACHE.EXE\" -n 
Apache2 -k runservice"
to the registry key...
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServices]

As a result, the service is started on reboot.  The computer (266 Mhz PII) 
appeared to lock up (actually, running dead slow) on reboot.  The configuration 
file MUST be modified for Win98SE so that it uses...  Win32DisableAcceptEx

I think this configuration setting should be built into the installation for 
Win98SE.

creator: slive@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 28529 ***
